hints.content: Start by understanding how to calculate the median of three numbers. The median is the middle value when the numbers are sorted. For instance, for the numbers [2, 1, 3], the median is 2.
Remember that you can only remove elements in groups of three. This means that the length of the array must always be divisible by 3, which is guaranteed by the problem statement.
Consider how the choice of elements affects the median. The largest median can be obtained by strategically selecting the largest numbers available in the array.
Think about sorting the array first. Once sorted, the largest medians will be easier to identify, as they will be located towards the end of the sorted list.

When you select three elements, the median will always be the second largest of the three. This means that if you want to maximize the median, you should focus on selecting the largest available elements.
Notice that after each selection of three elements, the array shrinks. Keep track of which elements have been removed to ensure you do not select them again.
You might want to use a greedy approach. Select the three largest elements available in each step to maximize the median sum. Think about how you can implement this in code.
Consider using a max-heap or a sorted list to efficiently manage the selection of the largest elements. This can help you quickly access the largest three elements for median calculation.
Make sure to account for edge cases, such as arrays with repeating elements or arrays where all elements are the same. How would these cases affect your median calculations?

Finally, after sorting the array, you could iterate backwards, selecting the last three elements, calculating their median, and summing it up until the array is empty. This approach will help you ensure you are always maximizing the median.

questionNotes: The length of nums is divisible by 3.
You can select any three elements to compute the median.
The median is defined as the middle value when sorted.
The output should be the maximum possible sum of the medians.
